channel.title: Portal 2 endings (major spoilers)
channel.description:
[url]https://youtube.com/watch?v=gj8qqSB52OM[/url] [url]https://youtube.com/watch?v=WAD90h1LA-Y[/url] [url]https://youtube.com/watch?v=43m4CRHrsgI[/url]
:fffuuu::fffuuu::fffuuu::fffuuu::fffuuu: FFFFFFFFFFFUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUU- I knew I shouldn't have watched...but...I did...god damn you valve why would you release the endings!?
Edit: I'm hoping these aren't real and just valve fucking with us

item.title: Portal 2 endings (major spoilers)
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
King_Kaddo:

[Spoiler]. [COLOR=‘Black’]Now that she has many human test subjects I think she is going to do a homicide in Portal 3.[COLOR=‘Black’](Giving the humans weapons and stuff) That would be like sex to her because robots can’t have sex in any other form.

So portal 3: Deathmatch is now entirely possib— wait…

People being forced to fight to the death with Ellen Mclain as the announcer voice…

TF2 was portal 3 the whole time.

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 endings (major spoilers)
item.dc:creator: MarshmallowRadiation
item.description:
cjohnson:

Oh I thought it was one of the best endings to a game ever. I really think that Chell’s story is finished (at least for now) and that for Portal 3 there will be a new protagonist.

Ratman? Then Valve can make the Companion Cube a talking character! :awesome:

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 endings (major spoilers)
item.dc:creator: uk_sniper
item.description:
i think there will be a portal 3. probably same time scales between 1 and 2. predominantly multiplayer, maybe GLaDOS decides that testing is not as fun as watching bots kill each other. Blammo 16/32/64 player portal based team death match, capture the companion cube and repulsion gel racing

item.description:
Faleiro:

Am I the only one that actually liked the ending?

I think it was owesome!

Oh I thought it was one of the best endings to a game ever. I really think that Chell’s story is finished (at least for now) and that for Portal 3 there will be a new protagonist.

item.title: Portal 2 endings (major spoilers)
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
GLaDOS was “doing Science”/“so much Science to do”. The capital “S” as in a name distinguishes it from regular “science”.

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 endings (major spoilers)
item.dc:creator: MarshmallowRadiation
item.description:
hicks1986:

My child, oh sky! (bambina= female child) (It’s a exclamation, “o ciel’/o cielo” sounds like Chell)

My theory is that Chell is Caroline’s adopted daughter. That’s why GLaDOS sent her away because she (GLaDOS) knew that Chell would be in danger if she stayed.

hicks1986:

Yes, far from Science (usually in Italian should be la scienza / the science but in this case Scienza seems be designed as a proper name)

“Science” as a proper name?

“Sorry folks, she’s married. To ‘Science!’”

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 endings (major spoilers)
item.dc:creator: hicks1986
item.description:
danielsangeo:

Maybe she’s singing “Mia bambina, O Chell” not “Oh sky” (which doesn’t make sense to me).

O ciel’

It’s an idiomatic expression, frequently used in the opera. Sounds a bitt different from “Oh Chell”

literally means “sky”, but in a broad sense could indicate the haven or God’s will.

And It’s clearly a word trick with Chell’s name.

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 endings (major spoilers)
item.dc:creator: jerry
item.description:
not really. there was rumours that GLaDOS was making clones in Portal, and wasn’t there clones in the ending of the co-op?

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 endings (major spoilers)
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
danielsangeo:

Maybe she’s singing “Mia bambina, O Chell” not “Oh sky” (which doesn’t make sense to me).

“Oh sky” could also be translated as “Oh Heavens!”

jerry:

implying Chell is a clone made by GLaDOS, then.

Imply: to involve by logical necessity.

It implies GLaDOS might see her self as a mother-figure to Chell, if you take it too literally, you can possibly interpret it as Caroline being Chell’s actual mother. Saying it’s because she’s a Clone takes a big stretch of the imagination.

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 endings (major spoilers)
item.dc:creator: jerry
item.description:
so it’s “Ah, my child, O Chell!” implying Chell is a clone made by GLaDOS, then.

item.title: Portal 2 endings (major spoilers)
item.dc:creator: Harun
item.description:
thanks for that!

i wasn’t sure if it were words when i heard it the first time

on topic, i found the single player ending was very good. most of all it was an ending, you really got the feeling it ended there, not some cliffhanger or something.
coop ending was entertaining and maybe hints at a new game. though not with chell, maybe

nothing is certain

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 endings (major spoilers)
item.dc:creator: hicks1986
item.description:
Uhuhuhuh… :retard:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Mo0vjUEO_v8

This song it’s in Italian!

Cara bell’, cara mia bella,
Mia bambina, o ciel!
Che la stima,
Che la stima,
O cara mia, addio!
La mia bambina cara,
perché non passi lontana?
Sì, lontana da Scienza,
Cara, cara mia bambina,
Ah, mia bell’!
Ah, mia cara!
Ah, mia cara!
Ah, mia bambina!
O cara, cara mia…

//

Dear lovely, my lovely darling,
My child, oh sky! (bambina= female child) (It’s a exclamation, “o ciel’/o cielo” sounds like Chell)
For it holds her in esteem, (understood subject / the sky )
For it holds her in esteem,
Oh my dear, farewell!
My dear girl,
why do you not pass far?
Yes, far from Science (usually in Italian should be la scienza / the science but in this case Scienza seems be designed as a proper name)
my dear, my dear girl,
Ah, my lovely!
Ah, my dear!
Ah, my dear!
Ah, my child!
Oh dear, my dear…

there are some things not clear. For example, When I listen more carefully the fifth line I realized that the voice don’t say “O cara mia, addio!/Oh my dear, farewell!” but something like “O Terra mia, addio/Oh my land, farewell”.

And you sould keep in mind that “Terra” means both “land” and “earth”. I’m still not sure at 100% 'cause the voice is heavily modified …

Read full topic
